position: Data Scientist Intern, Chief Analytics Office- 2021 Summer Intern
description:
The smartest companies today fully leverage data analytics for strategic decision making.The IBM Chief Analytics Office, a division of IBM Corporate Headquarters, combines business knowledge with big data to direct the future of IBM’s strategic transformation. Do you want to drive significant change within a leading global company and influence C-suite level decisions?


Are you passionate about harnessing the power of big data and analytics to address real-world business problems and play a key role in influencing change? If so, we want you to apply.


START AND END DATES FOR THIS INTERNSHIP ARE DURING SUMMER 2021 (3 MONTHS)


This position is an internal Data Scientist Intern role with the Chief Analytics Office. You will work alongside consultants, managers, and senior data scientists to enhance business performance through analytics and data science focused initiatives. The position’s main role and responsibilities include:


+ data exploration, extraction and manipulation

+ fact-based quantitative analysis using data visualization techniques

+ building innovative statistical and machine learning models, writing code, testing and validating

+ interpreting output and performance of models in business terms, communicating findings to the team

+ collaborating in a team environment


CAOeph


+ BS in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, or related STEM Fields

+ You must have proficiency in Python, R, SQL or another programming language

+ You have experience and/or coursework in statistics and machine learning

+ You have experience and/or coursework in exploratory data analysis and statistical modeling through software (e.g. SPSS) or programming language (e.g. Python)

+ You have understanding of database and analytical technologies in the industry as well as code versioning

+ You thrive in a collaborative team environment

+ You live or are willing to relocate to New York


+ You are pursuing a MS in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, or related STEM Fields

+ You have experience in data engineering for machine learning applications

+ You have experience and/or coursework in deep learning, with applications

+ You have professional experience with Spark and/or TensorFlow

+ You have effective written and verbal communication skills

+ You have demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product and technical challenges in an enterprise environment

+ You have hands-on experience deploying analytical models to solve business problems


The IBM Chief Analytics Office is an elite analytics consulting team that is tasked by IBM executives to pursue our most complex strategic issues. Our work is a combination of data science and management consulting. Through state of the art technology, and the power of artificial intelligence we strive to improve traditional business decision-making and processes.


What matters to you when you’re looking for your next career challenge?


Maybe you want to get involved in work that really changes the world? What about somewhere with incredible and diverse career and development opportunities – where you can truly discover your passion? Are you looking for a culture of openness, collaboration and trust – where everyone has a voice? What about all of these? If so, then IBM could be your next career challenge. Join us, not to do something better, but to attempt things you never thought possible.


Impact. Inclusion. Infinite Experiences. Do your best work ever.


IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that progress is made through progressive thinking, progressive leadership, progressive policy and progressive action. IBMers believe that the application of intelligence, reason and science can improve business, society and the human condition. Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are the largest technology and consulting employer in the world, with more than 380,000 IBMers serving clients in 170 countries.


For additional information about location requirements, please discuss with the recruiter following submission of your application.


IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Looking for an internship program where you'll make a real difference - rather than just completing busy work? Then you've come to the right place. Cigna's Summer Internship Program is designed to assign you projects that have a lasting impact on our business - which touches millions of people across the globe.

As an intern, you'll get an inside look at your desired field, while working next to some of the best in the industry. Program activities, including an executive speaker series, volunteer events, and career development workshops, give you the opportunity to network with employees across the organization and prepare you for a full-time career.

Where You'll Work

The Data Science Internship is an opportunity to be part of the most exciting company in healthcare, making medicine smarter and more affordable using data science. The internship will involve using data science techniques that include predictive modeling, machine learning, text mining, segmentation and clustering to help in developing solutions to increase revenue and improve Member Experience.

During this internship, the intern will utilize machine learning for developing the next generation of predictive models for targeted business solutions, support the team in the application of Text Mining to mine VoC data, and develop supervised/unsupervised algorithms for making business processes efficient.

Qualifications

• Must be working towards Masters Degrees or a Ph.D. in quantitative disciplines such as Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Econometrics, Finance, Engineering, Operations Research, Bioinformatics, Information Systems, Computational Linguistics or related quantitative disciplines or other similar degrees

• Excellent ability to query large datasets using ANSI SQL and working with relational databases

• Proficient programming skills either in SAS, R, or Python

• Proficient in Basic Probability and Statistics

• Preference is given to students with a 3.0 GPA or above with demonstrated proficiency in quantitative subjects.

Experience Desired

• Proficiency with one or more quantitative data analysis languages such as R, Python

• Demonstrated coursework/ real-world application of analytical methods such as Regression, Naïve-Bayes, Decision trees, experimental designs, support vector machines, machine learning and text mining, and Natural Language Processing

• Proficiency with relational database concepts and SQL preferred

• Proficiency in data manipulation, cleansing, and interpretation

• Knowledge of Big Data Technologies like Hive, Spark, Scala, HDFS

• Experience with visualization tools like Tableau, Shiny, ggplot, Matplotlib

• Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite

The following competencies/behaviors will be expected for incumbents in this position:

• Motivated self-starter

• Excellent verbal and written communication skills

• Attention to detail with excellent analytical skills

• Able to quickly pick up new ideas and new technologies

• Some Project Management knowledge helpful but not mandatory

About Cigna

Cigna Corporation (NYSE: CI) is a global health service company dedicated to improving the health, well-being and peace of mind of those we serve. We offer an integrated suite of health services through Cigna, Express Scripts, and our affiliates including medical, dental, behavioral health, pharmacy, vision, supplemental benefits, and other related products. Together, with our 74,000 employees worldwide, we aspire to transform health services, making them more affordable and accessible to millions. Through our unmatched expertise, bold action, fresh ideas and an unwavering commitment to patient-centered care, we are a force of health services innovation.

When you work with Cigna, you'll enjoy meaningful career experiences that enrich people's lives while working together to make the world a healthier place. What difference will you make? To see our culture in action, search #TeamCigna on Instagram.

If you require reasonable accommodation in completing the online application process, please email: SeeYourself@cigna.com for support. Do not email SeeYourself@cigna.com for an update on your application or to provide your resume as you will not receive a response.

Intro:

Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.

Summary:

The Infrastructure Quantitative Engineering group is responsible for the strategic analysis to support and enable the continued growth critical to Facebook’s infrastructure organization. We are applied quantitative and computational experts using math, statistics and machine learning to measure & optimize cost, performance, reliability and efficiency of Facebook’s infrastructure & global telecom systems to deliver the best experience to our global audience. The ideal candidate will be passionate about Facebook, have strong analytical and modeling aptitude and has experience using data to drive cost effective decision making.

Required Skills:

1. Build pragmatic, scalable, and statistically rigorous solutions to large-scale web, mobile and data infrastructure problems by leveraging or developing state-of-the-art statistical and machine learning methodologies on top of Facebook's unparalleled data infrastructure

2. Work cross-functionally to define problem statements, collect data, build analytical models and make recommendations

3. Build and maintain data driven optimization models, experiments, forecasting algorithms, and machine learning models

4. Identifies appropriate tools and methods to provide a simple and effective solution to problems

5. Leverage tools like Python, R, Hadoop & SQL to drive efficient analytics

6. Communicate final recommendations and drive decision making

Minimum Qualifications:

7. Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining, a Master's degree in a quantitative field (e.g. Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Operations Research or other related field)

8. 2+ years of industry or graduate research experience solving analytical problems and building models using quantitative, statistical or machine learning approaches

9. Experience with Machine Learning, Statistics, or other data analysis tools and techniques

10. Experience performing data extraction, cleaning, analysis and presentation for medium to large datasets

11. Experience with at least one programming language (i.e. Python, R, Java, or C++)

12. Experience writing SQL queries

13. Experience with scientific computing and analysis packages such as NumPy, SciPy, Pandas, Scikit-learn, dplyr, or ggplot2

14. Experience with statistics methods such as forecasting, time series, hypothesis testing, classification, clustering or regression analysis

15. Experience with data visualization libraries such as Matplotlib, Pyplot, ggplot2

16. Must obtain work authorization in the country of employment at the time of hire and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment

Preferred Qualifications:

17. Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining, a Master's or PhD degree in a quantitative field (e.g. Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Operations Research or other related field)

18. Experience working with distributed computing tools (Hadoop, Hive, Spark, etc.)

19. Experience with machine learning libraries and packages such as PyTorch, Caffe2, TensorFlow, Keras or Theano

20. Proficiency in algorithmic complexity

21. Intent to return to degree-program after the completion of the internship/co-op

Industry: Internet

Equal Opportunity: Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. Charged particle optics, electron and ion focusing systems, and high-brightness sources are at the heart of Thermo Fisher’s Scanning Electron Microscope (SEM), Focused Ion Beam (FIB), and Dual Beam tools serving the Nanotechnology market. The FIB Group seeks an intern to assist with the development and characterization of the next generation FIB columns. Activities include one or more of the following:

  • Develop and perform experiments to help characterize focused ion beams performance
  • Analyze experimental data and write reports
  • Perform simulations of charged particles optics systems for focused ion columns
  • Analyze electromagnetic fields, high voltage design, magnetic shielding, mechanical design, vacuum systems, and material selection
  • Maintain, troubleshoot, and repair laboratory equipment as necessary

Minimum Education, Experience and Qualifications:

  • Typically requires a degree in Physics or Engineering
  • Experience operating Thermo Fisher’s Dual Beam systems and microscopes is a plus
  • Demonstrated laboratory experience and hands-on skills
  • Computer programming experience is desired

position: Analytical Chemistry Intern - Lab Based Opportunity (Indianapolis, IN)
description:
Description


Grow what’s next. Grow your future. Corteva Agriscience is looking for an innovative and highly motivated student to join our Research & Development organization as an intern at the Indianapolis, Indiana site. Our internships are lab-based science positions, and students will work closely with a senior scientist in an industrial setting. Students that have past practical experience in a laboratory research environment, generating data, as well as relevant computer skills will be given top priority! Our interns are encouraged to be creative and take initiative and will be granted latitude for discretionary decisions and independence of action within guidelines established by their supervisor. Good interpersonal, communication, organizational, teamwork, and time management skills are essential to succeed at this opportunity!


Responsibilities - What You'll Do:


+ Participate in all phases of research including planning, preparation, calibration, application, evaluation, and analysis with supervisor.


+ Work in a safe manner and adopt our safety culture.


+ Become an independent and proficient scientist by making novel observations, interpreting data, and drawing sound scientific conclusions.


+ Present project reviews throughout the summer and a final poster before colleagues and peers.


Qualifications


Qualifications - What You'll Bring:


+ Analytical chemistry internships are available to junior or senior students that are currently pursuing a Bachelors or Masters degree in chemistry and will be enrolled in undergraduate or graduate classes fall of 2021.


+ Analytical or biochemistry focus preferred!


+ Minimum GPA 3.2.


+ Successful completion of two full years of undergraduate-level chemistry curriculum including associated laboratory courses.


+ Must be able to relocate to Indianapolis for the duration of the internship


+ Must be able to work full-time (40 hours per week) from May to August.
Corteva Agriscience ™, the world's first dedicated agriculture start-up, serves to enrich the lives of those who produce and those who consume, ensuring progress for generations to come. Our employees fulfill this purpose everyday by building/participating in an inclusive culture where we encourage each other to stay curious, think differently, act boldly and do what's right for our customers, our co-workers, our partners and our planet. With over 20,000 team members from 130 countries, innovating in 140 world class R&D facilities, we have the resources, leadership heritage and partner ecosystem to make a meaningful impact now and into the future.

Position Type: Internship

Location: Atlanta, GA/Oakland, CA

SiriusXM and Pandora have joined together to create the leading audio entertainment company in the U.S. Together, we are uniquely positioned to lead a new era of audio entertainment by delivering the most compelling subscription and ad-supported audio experiences to millions of listeners -- in the car, at home and on the go. Our talent, content, technology and innovation continue to be at the forefront, and we want you to be a part of it! Check out our current openings below and at www.siriusxm.com/careers.

Position Summary:
The content science team builds data science products and services for content creators such as artists, podcast and talk show hosts, curators, and programmers. We create the best-in-class curated audio catalog and programs, promote audio content, programs, and live events, and build personalized listening experiences for talk shows and podcasts.

Duties and Responsibilities:
• Contribute work to solve a broad set of problems ranging from enhancing our content understanding for our audio content to building recommendation algorithms to power our next generation of personalization services.
• Perform other duties as required.

Supervisory Responsibilities:
• None.

Minimum Qualifications:
• You must be 18 years of age or older.
• Internships are open to current students enrolled at a university and recent graduates who graduated within the 12-month period prior to the start of the internship.
• Pursuing a PhD degree in computer science, machine learning, statistics or a related quantitative field (ideally 1-2 years away from graduation).
• Demonstrated expertise in machine learning, natural language processing, recommendation systems, and/or statistics.

Requirements and General Skills:
• Excellent communication skills with both technical and non-technical audiences.
• Experience with the Hadoop technology stack.
• Publications at machine learning conferences/journals.
• Expertise in machine learning and statistics, solid programming skills, outstanding communication skills, and ability to work in a team with a diverse skill set.
• Must have legal right to work in the U.S.

Technical Skills:
• Familiarity with common machine learning libraries (e.g., sk-learn, TensorFlow).
• Proficiency with Python or Java.
• Experience with Spark and Scala.
• Experience with SQL (or proprietary equivalent).

Please note that all SiriusXM + Pandora internships are paid.

Our goal at SiriusXM+Pandora is to provide and maintain a work environment that fosters mutual respect, professionalism and cooperation. position: Forensics - Technology - FDA & Discovery - Charlotte - Intern - Summer 2021
description:
Forensics - Technology - FDA & Discovery - Charlotte - Intern - Summer 2021
        
      
        
      Assurance
        
      
        
      Requisition # CHA002Y9
        
      
        
      Post Date 1 day ago
        
      
        
      The EY Forensic & Integrity
      Services practice has a specialty technology consulting group with two service
      lines: Discovery Services and Forensic Data Analytics. Now is an exciting time
      to join the EY Forensic & Integrity Services team. Uncertain regulatory and
      enforcement priorities and changing business models continue to push companies
      and their business partners to operate with integrity while balancing their
      risks. Our professionals help organizations investigate alleged misconduct and mitigate
      cyber and financial risks.  We also perform
      electronic evidence discovery in response to external events. Our broad range
      of consulting services assists our clients with developing processes and
      identifying technologies to allow them to efficiently and effectively respond
      to investigations, breaches and/or discovery obligations.
        
      
        
      **The opportunity**
        
      
        
      As a Forensic & Integrity
      Services technology discovery intern, you will be hired into the following consulting
      service area (description below) across various clients, projects and
      industries.
        
      
        
      **Forensic Data Analytics Services**
        
      
        
      Forensic Data Analytics Services
      offer insights and factual evidence to help companies manage their legal,
      compliance and fraud risks. Our team combines extensive industry experience,
      data science and data analytics capabilities to help businesses detect and
      investigate instances of data breach, fraud, waste, misuse, abuse, corruption,
      noncompliance and cybercrime, and to assist them in regulatory or litigation
      responses. The candidate will have to define, design and develop client focused
      data analytics and data science algorithms, including leveraging the latest
      technologies such as natural language processing (NLP) and artificial
      intelligence (AI) . Additionally, the candidate will analyze and model
      structured data using advanced statistical methods, and implement algorithms
      and code necessary to perform analyses.   The candidate will also be expected to help
      continually innovate our data analytics tools, technology and client offerings,
      allowing our professionals to bring the latest concepts and services to our
      clients.
        
      
        
      **What to expect**
        
      
        
      You’ll find that every day at EY is
      a new opportunity, as you’ll have plenty of variety from working on different
      sectors, from banking to pharma to energy — where you’ll learn extensively
      about different IT infrastructures. We’ll need you to become an expert with our
      clients by guiding them through difficult situations within operations and
      systems. As part of that, you’ll need to learn a broad range of forensic tools
      and analytical technologies and develop an intimate knowledge of clients’
      systems and inter-workings.
        
      
        
      As a Forensic & Integrity
      Services staff, you will be introduced to EY Forensics’ various consulting
      service offerings and forensics, discovery, and analytics toolsets during an
      extensive three-week training program. Once you have developed basic skills
      related to Forensic Data Analytics you will have the opportunity to assist
      local and global engagement teams on various projects ranging from internal
      investigations to cyber incidents to discovery requests to consulting
      assessments—depending on your interests and travel preferences.
        
      
        
      **Your key responsibilities**
        
      
        
      + Develop strongrelationships among team members and work together to deliver exceptionalclient service
        
      + Build productiveworking relationships with clients
        
      + Stay informed ofbusiness, economic and technological developments and their impact to ourclients
        
      + Understand trends inour core industries and work with leadership to develop innovative solutions tosolve our clients’ complex business problems
        
      + Collaborate with teammembers to think critically and assist in the development of enhanced policies,processes and technologies that will address clients’ needs
        
      + Understand and analyzecurrent business processes and utilize analytical skills and tools to helpinfluence future strategic business decisions
        
      + Utilize technology tocontinually learn, share knowledge with team members and develop skills indiscovery, cyber and forensic data analytics
        
      + Make an immediateimpact with your work by writing code, collecting data from laptops and mobiledevices, managing evidence, processing and searching data, modeling analyticsinsights in visualization dashboards, and documenting key decisions andrecommendations for client delivery
        
      
        
      **To qualify for the role you must have**
        
      
        
      + Or be working toward, abachelor’s or master’s degree in Computer Science, Computer InformationSystems, IT Management, Business Analytics, Data Science, Information System& Analytics, Engineering, Management Information Systems or equivalent
        
      + A strong academicrecord, including, without limitation, course work that EY deems relevant tothis position
        
      + Superioranalytical skills and creative problem solving skills are a necessity.
        
      + Experience withrelational databases such as SAP, Oracle, DB2, and/or Microsoft SQL Server,  experience researching and manipulatingcomplex and large data sets; Hadoop experience a plus
        
      + Experience withvisualization tools such as Tableau, Spotfire or similar
        
      + Experience inanalytical and modelling tools, such as Python, R or SAS
        
      + Experience withNLP methods for information extraction, topic modelling, parsing, andrelationship extraction, Experience building machine learning systems byapplying best-in-class solutions including feature engineering, and tuning ofmodel hyper-parameters
        
      + A driver’s licensevalid in the US
        
      + Strong business processand analytical skills
        
      + Flexibility andwillingness to travel as well as work in excess of standard hours whennecessary
        
      
        
      **Ideally, you’ll also have**
        
      
        
      + Course work or a minorin Business, Analytics, Finance or Accounting
        
      + Experience in aninformation technology environment, preferably including programming in atleast two language (SQL, R, Python, Java, etc.) and relational database designand management
        
      + Proficiency in dataanalytics and experience using data visualization technologies
        
      + Experience in MachineLearning and NLP methods
        
      + Strong collaboration,teamwork and leadership skills
        
      + Excellent writing andcommunication skills are a bonus
        
      
        
      **What we look for**
        
      
        
      We’re interested in flexible people
      with excellent interpersonal skills who are able to think quickly on their feet
      and react quickly to solve complex business problems as well as adapt to
      challenging situations. We are looking for team players who are collaborative
      and outgoing. You’ll also need to be a self-motivator who is eager to learn new
      solutions and actively think of how you can help the client. If you’re a
      problem solver who is eager to learn new technologies and have an interest in
      helping organizations manage and mitigate information governance risks,
      fraudulent activities and misconduct in the workplace, this is the role for
      you.
        
      
        
      **Whatworking at EY offers**
        
      
        
      If you join EY full-time after your internship,
      we offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be
      rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to
      our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and
      dental coverage, pension and 401(k) plans, a minimum of 18 days of paid time
      off plus 12 observed holidays and a range of programs and benefits designed to
      support your physical, financial and social well-being.

description:
The smartest companies today fully leverage data analytics for strategic decision making.The IBM Chief Analytics Office, a division of IBM Corporate Headquarters, combines business knowledge with big data to direct the future of IBM’s strategic transformation. Do you want to drive significant change within a leading global company and influence C-suite level decisions?
        
      
        
      Are you passionate about harnessing the power of big data and analytics to address real-world business problems and play a key role in influencing change? If so, we want you to apply.
        
      
        
      **START AND END DATES FOR THIS INTERNSHIP ARE DURING SUMMER 2021 (3 MONTHS)**
        
      
        
      This position is an internal Data Scientist Intern role with the Chief Analytics Office. You will work alongside consultants, managers, and senior data scientists to enhance business performance through analytics and data science focused initiatives. The position’s main role and responsibilities include:
        
      
        
      + data exploration, extraction and manipulation
        
      + fact-based quantitative analysis using data visualization techniques
        
      + building innovative statistical and machine learning models, writing code, testing and validating
        
      + interpreting output and performance of models in business terms, communicating findings to the team
        
      + collaborating in a team environment
        
      
        
      CAOeph
        
      
        
      + BS in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, or related STEM Fields
        
      + You must have proficiency in Python, R, SQL or another programming language
        
      + You have experience and/or coursework in statistics and machine learning
        
      + You have experience and/or coursework in exploratory data analysis and statistical modeling through software (e.g. SPSS) or programming language (e.g. Python)
        
      + You have understanding of database and analytical technologies in the industry as well as code versioning
        
      + You thrive in a collaborative team environment
        
      + You live or are willing to relocate to New York
        
      
        
      + You are pursuing a MS in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, or related STEM Fields
        
      + You have experience in data engineering for machine learning applications
        
      + You have experience and/or coursework in deep learning, with applications
        
      + You have professional experience with Spark and/or TensorFlow
        
      + You have effective written and verbal communication skills
        
      + You have demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product and technical challenges in an enterprise environment
        
      + You have hands-on experience deploying analytical models to solve business problems
        
      
        
      The IBM Chief Analytics Office is an elite analytics consulting team that is tasked by IBM executives to pursue our most complex strategic issues. Our work is a combination of data science and management consulting. Through state of the art technology, and the power of artificial intelligence we strive to improve traditional business decision-making and processes.
        
      
        
      What matters to you when you’re looking for your next career challenge?
        
      
        
      Maybe you want to get involved in work that really changes the world? What about somewhere with incredible and diverse career and development opportunities – where you can truly discover your passion? Are you looking for a culture of openness, collaboration and trust – where everyone has a voice? What about all of these?  If so, then IBM could be your next career challenge. Join us, not to do something better, but to attempt things you never thought possible.
        
      
        
      Impact. Inclusion. Infinite Experiences. Do your best work ever.
        
      
        
      IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that progress is made through progressive thinking, progressive leadership, progressive policy and progressive action. IBMers believe that the application of intelligence, reason and science can improve business, society and the human condition. Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are the largest technology and consulting employer in the world, with more than 380,000 IBMers serving clients in 170 countries.
        
      
        
      For additional information about location requirements, please discuss with the recruiter following submission of your application.
        
      
        
      IBM  is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

**Intro:**  
      
      Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.
      
      **Summary:**  
      
      The Infrastructure Quantitative Engineering group is responsible for the strategic analysis to support and enable the continued growth critical to Facebook's infrastructure organization. We are applied quantitative and computational experts using math, statistics and machine learning to measure & optimize cost, performance, reliability and efficiency of Facebook's infrastructure & global telecom systems to deliver the best experience to our global audience. The ideal candidate will be passionate about Facebook, have strong analytical and modeling aptitude and has experience using data to drive cost effective decision making.
      
      **Required Skills:**  
      
      1. Build pragmatic, scalable, and statistically rigorous solutions to large-scale web, mobile and data infrastructure problems by leveraging or developing state-of-the-art statistical and machine learning methodologies on top of Facebook's unparalleled data infrastructure
      
      2. Work cross-functionally to define problem statements, collect data, build analytical models and make recommendations
      
      3. Build and maintain data driven optimization models, experiments, forecasting algorithms, and machine learning models
      
      4. Identifies appropriate tools and methods to provide a simple and effective solution to problems
      
      5. Leverage tools like Python, R, Hadoop & SQL to drive efficient analytics
      
      6. Communicate final recommendations and drive decision making
      
      **Minimum Qualifications:**  
      
      7. Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining, a Master's degree in a quantitative field (e.g. Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Operations Research or other related field)
      
      8. 2+ years of industry or graduate research experience solving analytical problems and building models using quantitative, statistical or machine learning approaches
      
      9. Experience with Machine Learning, Statistics, or other data analysis tools and techniques
      
      10. Experience performing data extraction, cleaning, analysis and presentation for medium to large datasets
      
      11. Experience with at least one programming language (i.e. Python, R, Java, or C++)
      
      12. Experience writing SQL queries
      
      13. Experience with scientific computing and analysis packages such as NumPy, SciPy, Pandas, Scikit-learn, dplyr, or ggplot2
      
      14. Experience with statistics methods such as forecasting, time series, hypothesis testing, classification, clustering or regression analysis
      
      15. Experience with data visualization libraries such as Matplotlib, Pyplot, ggplot2
      
      16. Must obtain work authorization in the country of employment at the time of hire and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment
      
      **Preferred Qualifications:**  
      
      17. Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining, a Master's or PhD degree in a quantitative field (e.g. Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Operations Research or other related field)
      
      18. Experience working with distributed computing tools (Hadoop, Hive, Spark, etc.)
      
      19. Experience with machine learning libraries and packages such as PyTorch, Caffe2, TensorFlow, Keras or Theano
      
      20. Proficiency in algorithmic complexity
      
      21. Intent to return to degree-program after the completion of the internship/co-op
      
      **Industry:**  Internet
      
      **Equal Opportunity:**  Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Facebook is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

Why CDM Smith?
CDM Smith provides lasting and integrated solutions in water, environment, transportation, energy and facilities to public and private clients worldwide. As a full-service consulting, engineering, construction, and operations firm, we deliver exceptional client service, quality results and enduring value across the entire project life cycle.

Job Description
CDM Smith’s Boca Raton office is looking for a GIS Intern to join the team! You'll be working with a dynamic team of industry leading engineers on a diverse portfolio of public, federal, and industrial projects. Are you ready to take the next step in your career? This Geographic Information Systems internship would be working with a range of GIS technologies to develop and analyze geographic data. You would also develop GIS data from a variety of source documents including engineering design plans, CADD files and reports. Gain experience creating and printing mapping products including utility drawing check plots. Assist in carrying out supervised quality control and assurance on GIS data including automated data integrity operations. May perform basic GIS analysis and query operations. May develop simple automation processes and scripts under supervision.

Minimum Qualifications
Currently enrolled and taking courses toward a Bachelors or Masters in Geography or a related field.

EEO Statement
We attract the best people in the industry, supporting their efforts to learn and grow. We strive to create a challenging and progressive work environment. We provide career opportunities that span a variety of disciplines and geographic locations, with projects that our employees plan, design, build and operate as diverse as the needs of our clients. CDM Smith is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.

Agency Disclaimer
All vendors must have a signed CDM Smith Placement Agreement from the CDM Smith Recruitment Center Manager to receive payment for your placement. Verbal or written commitments from any other member of the CDM Smith staff will not be considered binding terms. All unsolicited resumes sent to CDM Smith and any resume submitted to any employee outside of CDM Smith Recruiting Center Team (RCT) will be considered property of CDM Smith. CDM Smith will not be held liable to pay a placement fee.

position: Formulation & Material Science Intern - Lab Based Opportunity (Indianapolis, IN)
description:
Description


Grow what's next. Grow your future. Corteva Agriscience, is looking for students for full-time internships within our Research and Development organization in Indianapolis, Indiana. Our internships are lab-based science positions, and you will work closely with a senior scientist in an industrial setting. You should have past practical experience in a laboratory research environment, generating data, as well as relevant computer skills. You will be encouraged to be creative and take initiative, where appropriate, and will be granted latitude for discretionary decisions and independence of action within guidelines established by their supervisor. You are expected to always operate in a safe and efficient manner. Good interpersonal, communication, organizational, teamwork, and time management skills are essential.


Responsibilities - What You'll Do:


+ Participate in all phases of research including planning, preparation, calibration, application, evaluation, and analysis with supervisor.


+ Work in a safe manner and adopt our safety culture.


+ Become an independent and proficient scientist by making novel observations, interpreting data, and drawing sound scientific conclusions.


+ Present project reviews throughout the summer and a final poster before colleagues and peers.


Qualifications


Qualifications - What You'll Bring:


+ Formulation and material science internships are available to students that are currently pursuing a Bachelors, Masters, or Doctorate degree in chemistry, material science, polymer science, or a related field and will be enrolled in undergraduate or graduate classes fall of 2021.


+ Minimum GPA 3.2.


+ Must be able to relocate to the city of the internship (Indianapolis, IN).


+ Must be able to work full-time (40 hours per week) during the timeframe of May to August.
Corteva Agriscience ™, the world's first dedicated agriculture start-up, serves to enrich the lives of those who produce and those who consume, ensuring progress for generations to come. Our employees fulfill this purpose everyday by building/participating in an inclusive culture where we encourage each other to stay curious, think differently, act boldly and do what's right for our customers, our co-workers, our partners and our planet. With over 20,000 team members from 130 countries, innovating in 140 world class R&D facilities, we have the resources, leadership heritage and partner ecosystem to make a meaningful impact now and into the future.
#GrowWhatMatters
Corteva Agriscience, the agriculture division of DowDuPont, is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability or any other protected class. Accessibility Page for Contact Information

position: Summer Scientist Intern, Shared Foundation, Search, & Voice Intern
description:
Position Type: Internship
Session: Summer 2021
Location: Atlanta, GA; New York, NY; Dallas, TX; Oakland, CA

SiriusXM and Pandora have joined together to create the leading audio entertainment company in the U.S. Together, we are uniquely positioned to lead a new era of audio entertainment by delivering the most compelling subscription and ad-supported audio experiences to millions of listeners -- in the car, at home and on the go. Our talent, content, technology and innovation continue to be at the forefront, and we want you to be a part of it! Check out our current openings below and at www.siriusxm.com/careers.


Position Summary:
In this role you'll be working on a team designing and building the next innovations that will delight millions of listeners. You will have access to billions of hours of music listening history by hundreds of millions of listeners who have provided a hundred billion thumbs on their stations and playlists. And truly unique to SiriusXM + Pandora, you'll be working with extremely rich and diverse interlinked music and talk metadata, including annotations of our expert musicologists with the Music Genome Project's 450+ musical characteristics. With these resources at your fingertips, you will build systems that accelerate innovations in personalization, search & voice, content understanding, and advertising & marketing science.

Duties and Responsibilities:
• Contribute solutions to a broad set of machine learning problems ranging from novel recommendation algorithms to large-scale bandit problems, and from natural language understanding to information retrieval, all to build the next generation of audio entertainment.
• Perform other duties as required.

Supervisory Responsibilities:
• None.

Minimum Qualifications:
• You must be 18 years of age or older.
• Internships are open to current students enrolled at a university and recent graduates who graduated within the 12-month period prior to the start of the internship.
• Pursuing a PhD or MS degree in computer science, machine learning, statistics or a related quantitative field (ideally <2 years away from graduation).
Requirements and General Skills:
• Expertise in any of: applied causal inference, machine learning, statistics, search, voice interfaces.
• Solid programming skills.
• Demonstrated ability to work well in a small team with a diverse skill set.
• Excellent communication skills with both technical and non-technical audiences.
• Must have legal right to work in the U.S.

Technical Skills:
• Proficiency with data analysis, ML, and data visualization tools in Python or R.
• Familiarity with common machine learning libraries (e.g. sk-learn, TensorFlow).
• Experience with SQL (or proprietary equivalent).
• Experience with other languages like Java/Scala or big data tools (e.g. hive, spark) is a bonus.

Please note that all SiriusXM + Pandora internships are paid.

Our goal at SiriusXM+Pandora is to provide and maintain a work environment that fosters mutual respect, professionalism and cooperation. SiriusXM+Pandora is an equal opportunity employer that does not discriminate on the basis of actual or perceived race, creed, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, alienage or citizenship status, age, disability or handicap, sex, gender identity, marital status, familial status, veteran status, sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.

The requirements and duties described above may be modified or waived by the Company in its sole discretion without notice.

position: Forensics - Technology - FDA & Discovery - Atlanta - Intern - Summer 2021
description:
Forensics - Technology - FDA & Discovery - Atlanta - Intern - Summer 2021
        
      
        
      Assurance
        
      
        
      Requisition # ATL004KT
        
      
        
      Post Date 1 day ago
        
      
        
      The EY Forensic & Integrity
      Services practice has a specialty technology consulting group with two service
      lines: Discovery Services and Forensic Data Analytics. Now is an exciting time
      to join the EY Forensic & Integrity Services team. Uncertain regulatory and
      enforcement priorities and changing business models continue to push companies
      and their business partners to operate with integrity while balancing their
      risks. Our professionals help organizations investigate alleged misconduct and mitigate
      cyber and financial risks.  We also perform
      electronic evidence discovery in response to external events. Our broad range
      of consulting services assists our clients with developing processes and
      identifying technologies to allow them to efficiently and effectively respond
      to investigations, breaches and/or discovery obligations.
        
      
        
      **The opportunity**
        
      
        
      As a Forensic & Integrity
      Services technology discovery intern, you will be hired into the following consulting
      service area (description below) across various clients, projects and
      industries.
        
      
        
      **Forensic Data Analytics Services**
        
      
        
      Forensic Data Analytics Services
      offer insights and factual evidence to help companies manage their legal,
      compliance and fraud risks. Our team combines extensive industry experience,
      data science and data analytics capabilities to help businesses detect and
      investigate instances of data breach, fraud, waste, misuse, abuse, corruption,
      noncompliance and cybercrime, and to assist them in regulatory or litigation
      responses. The candidate will have to define, design and develop client focused
      data analytics and data science algorithms, including leveraging the latest
      technologies such as natural language processing (NLP) and artificial
      intelligence (AI) . Additionally, the candidate will analyze and model
      structured data using advanced statistical methods, and implement algorithms
      and code necessary to perform analyses.   The candidate will also be expected to help
      continually innovate our data analytics tools, technology and client offerings,
      allowing our professionals to bring the latest concepts and services to our
      clients.
        
      
        
      **What to expect**
        
      
        
      You’ll find that every day at EY is
      a new opportunity, as you’ll have plenty of variety from working on different
      sectors, from banking to pharma to energy — where you’ll learn extensively
      about different IT infrastructures. We’ll need you to become an expert with our
      clients by guiding them through difficult situations within operations and
      systems. As part of that, you’ll need to learn a broad range of forensic tools
      and analytical technologies and develop an intimate knowledge of clients’
      systems and inter-workings.
        
      
        
      As a Forensic & Integrity
      Services staff, you will be introduced to EY Forensics’ various consulting
      service offerings and forensics, discovery, and analytics toolsets during an
      extensive three-week training program. Once you have developed basic skills
      related to Forensic Data Analytics you will have the opportunity to assist
      local and global engagement teams on various projects ranging from internal
      investigations to cyber incidents to discovery requests to consulting
      assessments—depending on your interests and travel preferences.
        
      
        
      **Your key responsibilities**
        
      
        
      + Develop strongrelationships among team members and work together to deliver exceptionalclient service
        
      + Build productiveworking relationships with clients
        
      + Stay informed ofbusiness, economic and technological developments and their impact to ourclients
        
      + Understand trends inour core industries and work with leadership to develop innovative solutions tosolve our clients’ complex business problems
        
      + Collaborate with teammembers to think critically and assist in the development of enhanced policies,processes and technologies that will address clients’ needs
        
      + Understand and analyzecurrent business processes and utilize analytical skills and tools to helpinfluence future strategic business decisions
        
      + Utilize technology tocontinually learn, share knowledge with team members and develop skills indiscovery, cyber and forensic data analytics
        
      + Make an immediateimpact with your work by writing code, collecting data from laptops and mobiledevices, managing evidence, processing and searching data, modeling analyticsinsights in visualization dashboards, and documenting key decisions andrecommendations for client delivery
        
      
        
      **To qualify for the role you must have**
        
      
        
      + Or be working toward, abachelor’s or master’s degree in Computer Science, Computer InformationSystems, IT Management, Business Analytics, Data Science, Information System& Analytics, Engineering, Management Information Systems or equivalent
        
      + A strong academicrecord, including, without limitation, course work that EY deems relevant tothis position
        
      + Superioranalytical skills and creative problem solving skills are a necessity.
        
      + Experience withrelational databases such as SAP, Oracle, DB2, and/or Microsoft SQL Server,  experience researching and manipulatingcomplex and large data sets; Hadoop experience a plus
        
      + Experience withvisualization tools such as Tableau, Spotfire or similar
        
      + Experience inanalytical and modelling tools, such as Python, R or SAS
        
      + Experience withNLP methods for information extraction, topic modelling, parsing, andrelationship extraction, Experience building machine learning systems byapplying best-in-class solutions including feature engineering, and tuning ofmodel hyper-parameters
        
      + A driver’s licensevalid in the US
        
      + Strong business processand analytical skills
        
      + Flexibility andwillingness to travel as well as work in excess of standard hours whennecessary
        
      
        
      **Ideally, you’ll also have**
        
      
        
      + Course work or a minorin Business, Analytics, Finance or Accounting
        
      + Experience in aninformation technology environment, preferably including programming in atleast two language (SQL, R, Python, Java, etc.) and relational database designand management
        
      + Proficiency in dataanalytics and experience using data visualization technologies
        
      + Experience in MachineLearning and NLP methods
        
      + Strong collaboration,teamwork and leadership skills
        
      + Excellent writing andcommunication skills are a bonus
        
      
        
      **What we look for**
        
      
        
      We’re interested in flexible people
      with excellent interpersonal skills who are able to think quickly on their feet
      and react quickly to solve complex business problems as well as adapt to
      challenging situations. We are looking for team players who are collaborative
      and outgoing. You’ll also need to be a self-motivator who is eager to learn new
      solutions and actively think of how you can help the client. If you’re a
      problem solver who is eager to learn new technologies and have an interest in
      helping organizations manage and mitigate information governance risks,
      fraudulent activities and misconduct in the workplace, this is the role for
      you.
        
      
        
      **Whatworking at EY offers**
        
      
        
      If you join EY full-time after your internship,
      we offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be
      rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to
      our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and
      dental coverage, pension and 401(k) plans, a minimum of 18 days of paid time
      off plus 12 observed holidays and a range of programs and benefits designed to
      support your physical, financial and social well-being.
        
      
        
      **Plus, we offer:**
        
      
        
      + Support and coaching from some of themost engaging colleagues in the profession
        
      + Opportunities to develop new skills andprogress in your career
        
      + Gained flexibility through two-waycommunication and commitment with your engagement teams
        
      
        
      **About EY**
        
      
        
      As a global
      leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services, we hire and
      develop the most passionate people in their field to help build a better
      working world. This starts with a culture that believes in giving you the
      training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. So that
      whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a
      lifetime.
        
      
        
      **If you can confidently demonstrate that youmeet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.**
        
      
        
      **Make your mark. Apply today**
        
      
        
      EY
      provides equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees without
      regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender
      identity/expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability
      status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable
      law.

Intro:

Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.

Summary:

Are you passionate about Facebook’s product, analytics and technology? The Analytics, Data Engineering team is looking for fast-moving analytics candidates and data junkies who want to make an impact. Our data warehouse team works very closely with Product Managers, Product Analysts and Internet Marketers to figure out ways to acquire new users, retain existing users and optimize user experience - all of this using massive amounts of data. In this role, you will see a direct link between your work, company growth, and user satisfaction. You will work with some of the brightest minds in the industry, and you'll have the opportunity to solve some of the most challenging business problems on the web and mobile Internet, at a scale that few companies can match.

Required Skills:

1. Architect, implement and deploy new data models and data processes in production

2. Perform data analysis to generate business insights

3. Interface with Engineers, Product Managers and Product Analysts to understand product goals and data needs

4. Build data expertise and own data quality for allocated areas of ownership

5. Manage data warehouse plans for a product or a group of products

6. Support critical data processes running in production

Minimum Qualifications:

7. Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining, a Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, or related technical field

8. Programming knowledge in Python or Java

9. Knowledge of SQL

10. Knowledge of database systems

11. Must obtain work authorization in country of employment at the time of hire, and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment

Preferred Qualifications:

12. Intent to return to degree-program after the completion of the internship

13. Curious, self-driven, analytical and excited to play with data

14. Ability to thrive in a fast paced work environment

15. Experience in collaborating with individuals and organizations

Industry: Internet

Equal Opportunity: Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

You would also develop GIS data from a variety of source documents including engineering design plans, CADD files and reports.


Gain experience creating and printing mapping products including utility drawing check plots.


Assist in carrying out supervised quality control and assurance on GIS data including automated dta integrity operations.


May perform basic GIS analysis and query operations. May develop simple automation processes and scripts under supervision.


Job Title:


GIS Specialists Intern (Raleigh, NC Summer 2021)


Group:


ETO


CDM Smith Employment Type:


Temporary


Minimum Qualifications:


Currently enrolled and taking courses toward a Bachelors in Geography or a related field. 2 years of completed coursework and some experience with ArcGIS or GIS platforms strongly preferred but not required.


Preferred Qualifications:


Experience with ArcGIS Pro is a plus!


EEO Statement:


We attract the best people in the industry, supporting their efforts to learn and grow. We strive to create a challenging and progressive work environment. We provide career opportunities that span a variety of disciplines and geographic locations, with projects that our employees plan, design, build and operate as diverse as the needs of our clients. CDM Smith is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.


Why CDM Smith?:


CDM Smith provides lasting and integrated solutions in water, environment, transportation, energy and facilities to public and private clients worldwide. As a full-service consulting, engineering, construction, and operations firm, we deliver exceptional client service, quality results and enduring value across the entire project life cycle.


Job Site Location:


North Carolina - Raleigh


Agency Disclaimer:


All vendors must have a signed CDM Smith Placement Agreement from the CDM Smith Recruitment Center Manager to receive payment for your placement. Verbal or written commitments from any other member of the CDM Smith staff will not be considered binding terms. All unsolicited resumes sent to CDM Smith and any resume submitted to any employee outside of CDM Smith Recruiting Center Team (RCT) will be considered property of CDM Smith. CDM Smith will not be held liable to pay a placement fee.


Amount of Travel Required:


0%


Assignment Category:


Fulltime-Temporary


Visa Sponsorship Available:


No - We will not support sponsorship, i.e. H-1B or TN Visas for this position

position: Organic Chemistry Intern - Lab Based Opportunity (Indianapolis, IN)
description:
Description


Grow what's next. Grow your future. Corteva Agriscience is looking for students for full-time internships within our Research and Development organization in Indianapolis, Indiana. Our internships are lab-based science positions, and as an intern, you will work closely with a senior scientist in an industrial setting. You should have past practical experience in a laboratory research environment, generating data, as well as relevant computer skills. You are encouraged to be creative and take initiative, where appropriate, and will be granted latitude for discretionary decisions and independence of action within guidelines established by their supervisor. You are expected to always operate in a safe and efficient manner. Good interpersonal, communication, organizational, teamwork, and time management skills are essential to succeed at this opportunity!


Responsibilities - What You'll Do:


+ Participate in all phases of research including planning, preparation, calibration, application, evaluation, and analysis with supervisor.


+ Work in a safe manner and adopt our safety culture.


+ Demonstrate independent and creative thinking by making novel observations, interpreting data, and drawing sound scientific conclusions.


+ Present project reviews throughout the summer and a final poster before colleagues and peers.


Qualifications


Qualifications - What You'll Bring:


+ Organic chemistry internships are available to students that are currently pursuing a Bachelors or Masters degree in chemistry (organic, analytical, or biochemistry preferred) and will be enrolled in undergraduate or graduate classes fall of 2021.


+ Minimum GPA of 3.2.


+ Must be able to relocate to the city of the internship (Indianapolis, IN).


+ Must be able to work full-time (40 hours per week) during the timeframe of May to August.
Corteva Agriscience ™, the world's first dedicated agriculture start-up, serves to enrich the lives of those who produce and those who consume, ensuring progress for generations to come. Our employees fulfill this purpose everyday by building/participating in an inclusive culture where we encourage each other to stay curious, think differently, act boldly and do what's right for our customers, our co-workers, our partners and our planet. With over 20,000 team members from 130 countries, innovating in 140 world class R&D facilities, we have the resources, leadership heritage and partner ecosystem to make a meaningful impact now and into the future.
#GrowWhatMatters
Corteva Agriscience, the agriculture division of DowDuPont, is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability or any other protected class.
